name: Reality Street - West Side
description: Reality Street maintains its western border here, the pavement showing the kind of wear that comes from being a throughway between more interesting destinations. To the east, a gate in the chain-link fence provides the main western entrance to Highland Park - this section offering a view of what might be the park's central area where you can glimpse the top of what appears to be a fountain or monument, though whether it's functional is a question best answered by the optimistic. Graffiti on a nearby wall reads 'WASH ME' despite being a building, not a vehicle, suggesting someone had opinions about maintenance standards. The street continues north and south.
